Overview

An overview of the projects in general

Edge Magazine

On the Edge Magazine project, I am team lead. Charged with building a peer-reviewed undergraduate magazine/journal hybrid for the web from the ground up, I work to create a searchable, readable outward facing interface featuring content that students, alumni, and anyone curious about Georgia State University would want to absorb.

  • Writing the training manual for undergraduate level peer editors
  • Writing content such as submissions page, about page, and mission statement
  • Using Wordpress to create a simple, searchable online magazine-style interface
  • Working with faculty to build digital profiles that show off exceptional student work
  • Creating article models
  • Ensuring copyright compliance
  • Organizing the website so it is searchable and simple for readers
  • Presenting project progress
  • Team time and task management

Immigration ATL

Working for History Professor Dr. Marni Davis, I am tasked with making visualizations of her data about people who immigrated into Atlanta from the mid 1800â€™s to today.

  • Grouping data to create narratives
  • Creating graphs, charts, and maps using Tableau
  • Gathering requirements from the client
  • Presenting visualizations to the client
  • Creating multiple prototypes of visualization
  • Organizing team status meetings

Tobacco Ebook

Co-team lead to create an Ebook for the Department of Public Health about the dangers of smoking as part of their multi-million dollar grant. I recreated visuals to make them copyright compliant, set the format and layout of the Ebook using iBooks Author, selected visuals, and edited text associated with figures and references.

  • Researched available Ebook authoring tools
  • Designed Ebook using iBooks Author
  • Organized an event to crowdsource team for cover art and title of the book
  • Gathering requirements from the client
  • Ensuring copyright compliance
  • Edited text, figures and references, ensuring application functioned accordingly (checked links, etc.)
  • Showcased application to client

American Lit Bits

As team lead on the American Lit Bits project, I worked with American Literature faculty member Dr. Brennan Collins to realize a series of short videos on historical literary figures. My team collected video of an interdisciplinary array of professors answering questions on these figures, and edited the video so that they could be used in a variety of ways in any humanities course.

  • Recruited faculty to sit for video shoots
  • Built a video studio, including equipment testing
  • Prepped and filmed faculty
  • Wrote scripted questions
  • Edited video (iMovie, Adobe Premier Pro)
  • Packaged videos for social media presence
  • Presented video packages to faculty to test their usefulness in a classroom, or online lecture
